alert.note: Alert for Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 3:20PM CDT until June 04 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Deaf Smith, Oldham, Potter and Randall. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Umbarger, Bushland, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Palo Duro Canyon and Timbercreek Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
